course_title: Special Topics: Music: After The Golden Age
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 10Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Music Majors: this course counts towards elective credit.


This course will focus on introducing students to the most well-known pianists of the 20th and 21st century, will pose the question of diversity and inclusion in classical music and discuss socio-economic and political events that have a direct impact on classical music and performance. Through readings and listening assignments, students will learn to develop their own tastes and likings. By the end of the semester students will be able to compare the interpretational styles of various artists, comment on their musical choices and make informed decisions based on readings and in class discussions.
course_description: Selected topics in Music. May be repeated when topic varies.
